paper_abstract: A worst-case estimator for econometric models containing unobservable components, based on minimax principles for optimal selection of parameters, is proposed. Worst-case estimators are robust against the averse effects of unobservables. Computing worst-case estimators involves solving a minimax continuous problem, which is quite a challenging task. Large sample theory is considered, and a Monte Carlo study of finite-sample properties is conducted. A financial application is considered. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Worst-case estimation for econometric models with unobservable components
